I have a rather large jsp page which compiles fine if I use the weblogic jsp 
compiler, but I can't compile the java code that's generated by the jasper jsp 
compiler.

When I compile the java code generated by jasper for this specific jsp page I 
get the following errors :

    [javac] 
C:\DIGO\DINA\Ontwikkeling\Build\src\jsp_servlet\PerceelGunning.java:10213: code 
too large for try statement
    [javac]               try {
    [javac]                   ^
    [javac] 
C:\DIGO\DINA\Ontwikkeling\Build\src\jsp_servlet\PerceelGunning.java:10251: code 
too large for try statement
    [javac]                       try {
    [javac]                           ^
    [javac] 

.......

We only get these errors for one jsp page, which also happens to be our largest 
jsp page.  The jsp itself is 71 Kb and the java code for the jsp is 663 Kb (and 
about 11000 lines).

I can send you the jsp page and the generated java code (from both the weblogic 
jsp compiler and the Jasper jsp compiler) if you like.

Just let me know if you need more information.

text:
I think you may have ran into a VM contraint that limits the size of byte codes
in a method to less than 65536.  You may not have this problem with other jsp
compilers because they may generate different servlet code.

You can

1. Restructure your page so that size of each page is small enough.  You may,
for instance, use <jsp:include> to put part of the page in another page.

2. Specify "largefile" option for jsp compiler in the config/web.xml to store
the static portion of the jsp page into a file, so that the size of the byte
code in the method is reduced.

Since this is a hard limit in the VM, and there is no known easy fix, it is
unlikely that this problem will be fixed soon.
